intro: Ornithogalum baeticum subsp. algeriense, commonly known as Algerian star-of-Bethlem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
